cab.content: (THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'8 GOVERNMENT)SECRET.W.P.(G)(hC) 2U8 COPY NO. ^ T26TH SEPTEMBER, 1940.WAR CABINET.AIR RAIDS: COMPENSATION FOR PERSONAL INJURIES.Report by the Lord Privy Seal.At its Meeting on the 23rd September the WarCabinet invited a committee of Ministers, with myselfas Chairman, "to consider the question of compensationfor personal injury in air raids and to report to theWar Cabinet on Friday. 27th September". (W.M. (LuO) 256thConclusions, Minute 9juI now circulate the conclusions of a meeting ofthe Committee held on 21+th September.(Intld.) C.R.A.The Committee:-(a) Invited the Chairman to inform the War Cabinetthat the Committee agreed in principle that theexisting scheme of compensation for death orinjury from air raids should be made of general application to the whole civilian population;(b) Invited the Chancellor of the Exchequer to convene a Meeting of Officials from the followingDepartmentsThe treasury the Service departments the Board of trade the Ministry of labour the Ministry of health the Ministry of Pensions(1) to consider the administrative questions involved in giving effect to the decisionof principle set out in (a):(ii)' to make alternative proposals, in the lightof the Committee!s discussion, for contributoryschemes for compensation for personal injury,additional to the State scheme -(a) on a voluntary basis:(b) on a compulsory basis.Richmond Terrace, S.W. 1. ,26th September, 1940.
